LanguageData.RF.Pylon.NoNetwork: Idle, not connected to power grid.
LanguageData.RF.Pylon.ForceDisabled: Invalid, cannot receive power from '{0}' because there is a sender on the same power grid and channel.
LanguageData.RF.Pylon.ChannelInfoUnsatisfied: Due to insufficuent input, {0} receivers are not getting the power they requested.
LanguageData.RF.Pylon.ConfigureDesc: Change this {0}'s settings, such as what channel to connect to and the amount of power sent or received.
LanguageData.RF.Pylon.DisabledMultipleSelected: Cannot configure multiple {0}s at once. Configure one, and then use the copy-paste buttons.
LanguageData.RF.Pylon.DisabledCopyMultipleSelected: Cannot copy config from multiple {0}s at once.
LanguageData.RF.Pylon.PasteDisabled: Cannot paste config, the clipboard is empty!
LanguageData.RF.Coil.Blocked: Link blocked by {0}, will not fire!
LanguageData.RF.Coil.NotLinked: Not linked, will not fire!\nNote: this coil may be the 'passive' coil.
LanguageData.RF.Coil.LinkDesc: Links this tesla coil to another.\nThis coil becomes the 'active' coil, and the other is 'passive'. Read coil description for more info.
LanguageData.RF.Coil.AlreadyLinked: The target coil is already linked to this one (this one is the 'passive').
LanguageData.RF.Coil.TooFar: The target coil is too far away.
LanguageData.RF.Stats.MadeUsingDesc: This is an alloy that is created at a Forge, using the following materials:
LanguageData.RF.Stats.MeltingPointDesc: The melting point of this material, relevant when trying to make alloys out of it in a Forge.
LanguageData.RF.Stats.UsedToMakeDesc: This resource is needed to make the following alloys at a Forge:
LanguageData.RF.Stats.EquivalentToDesc: Equivalent materials are interchangable in forge recipes. This is done to allow larger mod compatibility, in the cases where other mods add their own version of resources added by RimForge.
LanguageData.RF.Coilgun.AttackDesc: Choose a target and fire at it. WARNING: Firing cannot be cancelled once started!
LanguageData.RF.Coilgun.Disabled: Cannot fire: not enough capacitors or not enough energy stored in capacitors.
LanguageData.RF.Coilgun.CapState: Shot power: {0}% ({1} connected capacitors, {2} stored Wd)
LanguageData.RF.Cap.NoBatteries: There are no batteries on the power grid! There must be at least 1 battery on the same power grid as this capacitor!
LanguageData.RF.Cap.NoPower: There is not enough power to recharge this capacitor!
LanguageData.RF.LR.FailNoPowerNet: Lightning rod caught lightning bolt, but is not connected to a power grid!
LanguageData.RF.LR.FailNoBatteries: Lightning rod caught lightning bolt, but there are no batteries on the power grid! The power was harmlessly passed into the ground.
LanguageData.RF.LR.Success: Lightning rod caught lightning bolt, charging batteries with {0} Wd of power!
